div.p: Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tenn
J. L. DODDS
23 Engineers
Camp Mead
Md
Camp Meade Md
Dear Ellen -

I receved your letter this pm. And was real glad to here from you I was just getting ready to ball ever body out. when at last I got your letter I guess the delay must be here in the camp I havent heard a word from any of my people I am sure I have some more mail here some where. Some of the boys are getting mail that was wrote two weeks ago and more
I mailed you a card last night and I was at the Y.M.C.A. and closing time come and I had to quit before I finished it

I was trying to tell you about getting quaranteened They have most all of the barracks quaranteened now and I guess we will get in it before it is over and if we do I cannt write and if I shouldnt write for a while you may know I am quaranteened I want you to write any
way if I count

Well it is ever thing but warm up here I almost freeze we have had a few warm days. but I would call them cold if I was at home There has been snow on the ground ever sincewe got here and I dont see murch chance of it going away I am kindly getting use to it now. And I will tell you I am some walker now I have done more walking since I joined the army than I did in a year at home They take us out on a hike most ever day so if I ever get back home I wont need a street car to go any where I want to go from Jaxon I can walk

Well you said you bet I make a good looking soldier. You loose and I win for I dont thank I look so well in my uniform I have never got to see myself though I dont know how I look I dont thank there is a mirror in this camp large enough for a fellow to see himself

I didnt know Lynn had enlisted I wish I could have stayed some where close to home It will take a month pay for me to get home. But I dont verry murch of getting a chance to come home before I go across the pond I thank in 2 months I will be on my way to France I am just guessing at it but that is the way it looks now
Well I bet they are having a dance some where to night and O how I wish was there Not only to the dance but to see you and others I know in the city.

You spoke of Santa well I didnt know there was surch a fellow this Christmas The Red Cross gave me a checker board as hankerchief and a sack of tobacco was all the Santie I had but that is more than I expected
Well maybe I will have more some day I wouldnt know what to do with any thing Sontie would bring Any way I have a laundry bag

and have to keep all of my clothes in it. I bet Esther was disapointed Xmas when Cecil didnt get to come from Jaxon Yes I thank she is crazy about the man Well I cant blame her a bit. I am sure I would like to have some one crazy about me but I dont think there is a chance there has never surch a thing happened yet

Well I guess I will have to quit for it is almost bed time and I tell you when a fellow has to get up at 5:30 oclock he has to go to bed early and they make us go to bed by 9:30 whether we want to or not so you can see it not what you want it what you get
Well now I want you to write real often abd dont always wait for an answer for some times I count write just when I want to and I may get quaranteened
Wishing you a happy New Year with love James L.
23 Engineers Recruting Detachment
Camp Meade Md.
Tell ever body hello for me
